qas.question: Who wrote the 2007 book The Black Swan?
What journalist from the New York Times stated his believe in Nassim Nicholas Taleb?
What did Nassim Nicholas Taleb warn about for years prior to the financial crisis of 2007?

answers.text: the breakdown of the banking system

qas.question: What did Nassim Nicholas Taleb make a fortune on by making a big financial bet?

context: Stock trader and financial risk engineer <a0_0>Nassim Nicholas Taleb<a0_0/>, author of the 2007 book The Black Swan, spent years warning against <a2_0>the breakdown of the banking system<a2_0/> in particular and the economy in general owing to their use of bad risk models and reliance on forecasting, and their reliance on bad models, and framed the problem as part of "robustness and fragility". He also took action against the establishment view by making a big financial bet on <a3_0>banking stocks<a3_0/> and making a fortune from the crisis ("They didn't listen, so I took their money"). According to <a1_0>David Brooks<a1_0/> from the New York Times, "Taleb not only has an explanation for what’s happening, he saw it coming."
